newsitem.title: ITALY: RUGBY UNION-CAMPESE GETS 100TH CAP BUT AUSTRALIA FIND GOING HARD.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-CAMPESE GETS 100TH CAP BUT AUSTRALIA FIND GOING HARD.

text.p: Winger David Campese collected his 100th international cap on Wednesday as Australia made hard work of getting the better of Italy 40-18.
The visitors celebrated at the whistle but it was more in relief than anything else after finding themselves lagging behind the hosts 18-13 in the second half.
Campese, 34 years old on Monday, came on to a roar and a banner declaring "Some say God, we say Campo!"
It was undoubtedly his night but Australia made heavy weather of the match and Campese, despite a few delightful touches, had a subdued first half.
Fullback Mathew Burke missed three penalty kicks in the first 10 minutes before flanker David Wilson put the visitors ahead with a try after Michael Brial made the run.

Stefano Bordon put Italy back in the game with a 22nd minute try and former Puma flyhalf Diego Dominguez delighted the crowd with a drop goal in the 25th as a confident Italy team took the lead for the first time.
Burke replied with a penalty in the 33rd minute and another on the stroke of half time.
Six minutes into the second half Dominguez deftly side-stepped limping flyhalf David Knox for Italy's second try and then converted for a 15-13 lead.
Knox was substituted by Jason Little as Australia went further behind to a Dominguez penalty.
Burke kicked two more penalties to put Australia 19-18 ahead before the American referee Ed Sorenson gave the visitors a helping hand with a call that incensed the locals.
He ruled Michael Foley had scored a pushover try despite Italian protests that he had not. The crowd shouted "idiot, idiot" and no Australian claimed the honours.
Italy scored no further points and faded badly, with Australian vice-captain Tim Horan scoring a beautiful try in the 75th and Wilson his second in the final minute.
